revenue_streams: Subscription-based access to the EVA platform. Companies pay a recurring fee (monthly or annual) to use the AI-driven interview and assessment tools.
Potentially tiered pricing based on the number of candidates assessed, features used (e.g., simulation capabilities, advanced reporting), or the size of the client organization.

Customized solutions and integrations for enterprise clients. This could involve tailoring the EVA platform to specific industry needs or integrating it with existing HR systems. These customizations would command a higher price point.

Possible revenue from data analytics and insights. Anonymized and aggregated data from candidate assessments could be valuable to organizations seeking to understand talent trends and improve their hiring strategies. However, this would need to be carefully managed to ensure compliance with privacy regulations.
Partnerships with recruitment agencies or HR consulting firms, offering EVA as a value-added service to their clients, potentially involving revenue sharing or referral fees.
business_model.pricing_strategy: Likely a value-based pricing strategy, where the price is determined by the value iVerse provides to its customers. This value includes reduced hiring costs (52% reduction claimed), faster hiring times (36% reduction claimed), and improved hiring accuracy (89% precision claimed). They may also use competitive pricing by analyzing the pricing of similar AI-powered HR tech solutions. They could offer different subscription tiers to cater to different customer needs and budgets. Could also include freemium model with limited access to entice customers to upgrade to paid plans.
business_model.customer_acquisition: Focus on direct sales to HR departments and recruitment teams within companies. Target companies struggling with high hiring costs, long hiring cycles, or poor candidate quality. Could also include content marketing (blog posts, webinars, white papers) showcasing the benefits of AI-driven hiring and EVA's capabilities. Participation in HR tech conferences and industry events to generate leads and build brand awareness. Strategic partnerships with recruitment agencies and HR consulting firms to expand reach. Targeted advertising on LinkedIn and other platforms frequented by HR professionals. Referral programs to incentivize existing customers to recommend EVA to their network.
partnerships: Recruitment agencies: Partnering with recruitment agencies to offer EVA as a tool to enhance their services and improve candidate selection.
HR consulting firms: Collaborating with HR consulting firms to integrate EVA into their consulting engagements and provide clients with data-driven hiring solutions.
Applicant Tracking System (ATS) providers: Integrating EVA with popular ATS platforms to streamline the hiring process and provide a seamless experience for users.
Job boards: Partnering with job boards to offer EVA as an assessment tool for candidates applying to jobs listed on their platform.
Technology partners: Collaborating with other technology companies to enhance EVA's capabilities or expand its reach (e.g., AI/ML providers, data analytics firms).
business_model.scaling_strategy: Focus on acquiring new customers within Israel initially, then expand to other markets (e.g., North America, Europe). Develop a strong sales and marketing team to drive customer acquisition. Invest in platform infrastructure to support high-volume usage and ensure scalability. Continuously improve the EVA platform based on customer feedback and market trends. Explore strategic partnerships to expand reach and access new markets. Could include a channel partner program. Standardize the onboarding process to efficiently scale customer acquisition. Create comprehensive training materials and documentation to help customers get the most out of the EVA platform. Focus on customer retention by providing excellent customer support and continuously adding value to the platform.
